meanings.definition: To repair or replace the cane on (a piece of furniture).
meanings.sent1: My grandfather recaned his favorite chair to make it sturdy again.
meanings.sent2: The skilled craftsman recaned the old rocking chair beautifully.
meanings.sent3: After a long day of work, he recaned the chair and felt a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent4: She recaned the seat of the chair with care, like weaving a story into its fibers.
meanings.sent5: The sound of recaning echoed through the workshop, a melody of restoration.

meanings.definition: Having been repaired or replaced with new cane.
meanings.sent1: The recaned chair looked brand new and ready for use.
meanings.sent2: The recaned stool was now comfortable to sit on.
meanings.sent3: She proudly displayed her recaned furniture to her friends, who admired the craftsmanship.
meanings.sent4: The recaned bench stood out in the garden, a symbol of renewal.
meanings.sent5: The recaned table gleamed in the sunlight, a testament to the care it received.
